page.title: 06Disused Railway Line-W.Upton
page.content: Through the eastern part of this area is the course of a disused railway. This railway originally formed a link between the Wolverhampton/Shrewsbury line at Wellington,(still operating), and Market Drayton, Crewe and Stoke-on-Trent to the north. The line was closed during the 1960s following the Beeching Report of 1963. As a line serving rural area, it was under-used and uneconomical. There was a station at Crudgington, but little evidence now remains. The opportunity to turn the disused line into a footpath was not taken: farmers divided up the land around the railway. The track has been removed and vegetation has re-colonised the route.
